The integer represents the number of pixels that have scrolled above the top of the field’s rectangle. For example, the number of lines scrolled in card field 1 equals the scroll of card field 1 div the textHeight of card field 1.

or fields, HyperCard pins the scroll to a number between 0 and the maximum value for the field. For the card window, the scroll property returns or sets a point that specifies the current horizontal and vertical offsets of the portion of the card currently visible in the card window. It affects the card image only when the size of the window is smaller than the size of the card.
